content.description: Students enrolled in an introductory psychology course want to examine the bystander effect on their campus. The students devise a study in which one of them will pretend to fall while riding a scooter. The students choose a confederate from among the group to ride the scooter. The confederate will fall at the same location when many students are present. Then, the next day, the confederate will fall at the same location when fewer students are present. After each fall, the confederate will record whether they are helped.
content.question: Which of the following best represents the description of an independent variable in this study?

choices.label: The number of people at the location when the confederate fell
The level of experience of the scooter rider
The location on the campus where the confederate fell
The students on campus who watched the confederate fall off the scooter

content.answer: The number of people at the location when the confederate fell

skill.text: 2.B: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in experimental methodology.
